verses.verse: I am the man <S%H1397><s%> that hath seen <S%H7200><s%> affliction <S%H6040><s%> by the rod <S%H7626><s%> of his wrath <S%H5678><s%>.
He hath led <S%H5090><s%> me, and brought <S%H3212><s%> me into darkness <S%H2822><s%>, but not into light <S%H216><s%>.
Surely against me is he turned <S%H7725><s%>; he turneth <S%H2015><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> against me all the day <S%H3117><s%>.
My flesh <S%H1320><s%> and my skin <S%H5785><s%> hath he made old <S%H1086><s%>; he hath broken <S%H7665><s%> my bones <S%H6106><s%>.
He hath builded against <S%H1129><s%> me, and compassed <S%H5362><s%> me with gall <S%H7219><s%> and travail <S%H8513><s%>.
He hath set <S%H3427><s%> me in dark places <S%H4285><s%>, as they that be dead <S%H4191><s%> of old <S%H5769><s%>.
He hath hedged <S%H1443><s%> me about, that I cannot get out <S%H3318><s%>: he hath made my chain <S%H5178><s%> heavy <S%H3513><s%>.
Also when I cry <S%H2199><s%> and shout <S%H7768><s%>, he shutteth out <S%H5640><s%> my prayer <S%H8605><s%>.
He hath inclosed <S%H1443><s%> my ways <S%H1870><s%> with hewn stone <S%H1496><s%>, he hath made my paths <S%H5410><s%> crooked <S%H5753><s%>.
He was unto me as a bear <S%H1677><s%> lying in wait <S%H693><s%>, and as a lion <S%H738><s%> in secret places <S%H4565><s%>.
He hath turned aside <S%H5493><s%> my ways <S%H1870><s%>, and pulled me in pieces <S%H6582><s%>: he hath made <S%H7760><s%> me desolate <S%H8074><s%>.
He hath bent <S%H1869><s%> his bow <S%H7198><s%>, and set <S%H5324><s%> me as a mark <S%H4307><s%> for the arrow <S%H2671><s%>.
He hath caused the arrows <S%H1121><s%> of his quiver <S%H827><s%> to enter <S%H935><s%> into my reins <S%H3629><s%>. arrows: Heb. sons
I was a derision <S%H7814><s%> to all my people <S%H5971><s%>; and their song <S%H5058><s%> all the day <S%H3117><s%>.
He hath filled <S%H7646><s%> me with bitterness <S%H4844><s%>, he hath made me drunken <S%H7301><s%> with wormwood <S%H3939><s%>. bitterness: Heb. bitternesses
He hath also broken <S%H1638><s%> my teeth <S%H8127><s%> with gravel stones <S%H2687><s%>, he hath covered <S%H3728><s%> me with ashes <S%H665><s%>. covered: or, rolled me in the ashes
And thou hast removed <S%H2186><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> far off <S%H2186><s%> from peace <S%H7965><s%>: I forgat <S%H5382><s%> prosperity <S%H2896><s%>. prosperity: Heb. good
And I said <S%H559><s%>, My strength <S%H5331><s%> and my hope <S%H8431><s%> is perished <S%H6><s%> from the LORD <S%H3068><s%>:
Remembering <S%H2142><s%> mine affliction <S%H6040><s%> and my misery <S%H4788><s%>, the wormwood <S%H3939><s%> and the gall <S%H7219><s%>. Remembering: or, Remember
My soul <S%H5315><s%> hath them still <S%H2142><s%> in remembrance <S%H2142><s%>, and is humbled <S%H7743><s%> in me. humbled: Heb. bowed
This I recall <S%H7725><s%> to my mind <S%H3820><s%>, therefore have I hope <S%H3176><s%>. recall: Heb. make to return to my heart
It is of the LORD'S <S%H3068><s%> mercies <S%H2617><s%> that we are not consumed <S%H8552><s%>, because his compassions <S%H7356><s%> fail <S%H3615><s%> not.
They are new <S%H2319><s%> every morning <S%H1242><s%>: great <S%H7227><s%> is thy faithfulness <S%H530><s%>.
The LORD <S%H3068><s%> is my portion <S%H2506><s%>, saith <S%H559><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%>; therefore will I hope <S%H3176><s%> in him.
The LORD <S%H3068><s%> is good <S%H2896><s%> unto them that wait <S%H6960><s%> for him, to the soul <S%H5315><s%> that seeketh <S%H1875><s%> him.
It is good <S%H2896><s%> that a man should both hope <S%H3175><s%> <S%H2342><s%> and quietly wait <S%H1748><s%> for the salvation <S%H8668><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>.
It is good <S%H2896><s%> for a man <S%H1397><s%> that he bear <S%H5375><s%> the yoke <S%H5923><s%> in his youth <S%H5271><s%>.
He sitteth <S%H3427><s%> alone <S%H910><s%> and keepeth silence <S%H1826><s%>, because he hath borne <S%H5190><s%> it upon him.
He putteth <S%H5414><s%> his mouth <S%H6310><s%> in the dust <S%H6083><s%>; if so be there may be <S%H3426><s%> hope <S%H8615><s%>.
He giveth <S%H5414><s%> his cheek <S%H3895><s%> to him that smiteth <S%H5221><s%> him: he is filled full <S%H7646><s%> with reproach <S%H2781><s%>.
For the Lord <S%H136><s%> will not cast off <S%H2186><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%>:
But though he cause grief <S%H3013><s%>, yet will he have compassion <S%H7355><s%> according to the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of his mercies <S%H2617><s%>.
For he doth not afflict <S%H6031><s%> willingly <S%H3820><s%> nor grieve <S%H3013><s%> the children <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H376><s%>. willingly: Heb. from his heart
To crush <S%H1792><s%> under his feet <S%H7272><s%> all the prisoners <S%H615><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>,
To turn aside <S%H5186><s%> the right <S%H4941><s%> of a man <S%H1397><s%> before the face <S%H6440><s%> of the most High <S%H5945><s%>, the most High: or, a superior
To subvert <S%H5791><s%> a man <S%H120><s%> in his cause <S%H7379><s%>, the Lord <S%H136><s%> approveth <S%H7200><s%> not. approveth not: or, seeth not
Who is he that saith <S%H559><s%>, and it cometh to pass, when the Lord <S%H136><s%> commandeth <S%H6680><s%> it not?
Out of the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of the most High <S%H5945><s%> proceedeth <S%H3318><s%> not evil <S%H7451><s%> and good <S%H2896><s%>?
Wherefore doth a living <S%H2416><s%> man <S%H120><s%> complain <S%H596><s%>, a man <S%H1397><s%> for the punishment of his sins <S%H2399><s%>? complain: or, murmur
Let us search <S%H2664><s%> and try <S%H2713><s%> our ways <S%H1870><s%>, and turn again <S%H7725><s%> to the LORD <S%H3068><s%>.
Let us lift up <S%H5375><s%> our heart <S%H3824><s%> with our hands <S%H3709><s%> unto God <S%H410><s%> in the heavens <S%H8064><s%>.
We <S%H5168><s%> have transgressed <S%H6586><s%> and have rebelled <S%H4784><s%>: thou hast not pardoned <S%H5545><s%>.
Thou hast covered <S%H5526><s%> with anger <S%H639><s%>, and persecuted <S%H7291><s%> us: thou hast slain <S%H2026><s%>, thou hast not pitied <S%H2550><s%>.
Thou hast covered <S%H5526><s%> thyself with a cloud <S%H6051><s%>, that our prayer <S%H8605><s%> should not pass through <S%H5674><s%>.
Thou hast made <S%H7760><s%> us as the offscouring <S%H5501><s%> and refuse <S%H3973><s%> in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of the people <S%H5971><s%>.
All our enemies <S%H341><s%> have opened <S%H6475><s%> their mouths <S%H6310><s%> against us.
Fear <S%H6343><s%> and a snare <S%H6354><s%> is come upon us, desolation <S%H7612><s%> and destruction <S%H7667><s%>.
Mine eye <S%H5869><s%> runneth down <S%H3381><s%> with rivers <S%H6388><s%> of water <S%H4325><s%> for the destruction <S%H7667><s%> of the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of my people <S%H5971><s%>.
Mine eye <S%H5869><s%> trickleth down <S%H5064><s%>, and ceaseth <S%H1820><s%> not, without any intermission <S%H2014><s%>,
Till the LORD <S%H3068><s%> look down <S%H8259><s%>, and behold <S%H7200><s%> from heaven <S%H8064><s%>.
Mine eye <S%H5869><s%> affecteth <S%H5953><s%> mine heart <S%H5315><s%> because of all the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of my city <S%H5892><s%>. mine heart: Heb. my soul because: or, more than all
Mine enemies <S%H341><s%> chased <S%H6679><s%> me sore <S%H6679><s%>, like a bird <S%H6833><s%>, without cause <S%H2600><s%>.
They have cut off <S%H6789><s%> my life <S%H2416><s%> in the dungeon <S%H953><s%>, and cast <S%H3034><s%> a stone <S%H68><s%> upon me.
Waters <S%H4325><s%> flowed over <S%H6687><s%> mine head <S%H7218><s%>; then I said <S%H559><s%>, I am cut off <S%H1504><s%>.
I called <S%H7121><s%> upon thy name <S%H8034><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, out of the low <S%H8482><s%> dungeon <S%H953><s%>.
Thou hast heard <S%H8085><s%> my voice <S%H6963><s%>: hide <S%H5956><s%> not thine ear <S%H241><s%> at my breathing <S%H7309><s%>, at my cry <S%H7775><s%>.
Thou drewest near <S%H7126><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> that I called <S%H7121><s%> upon thee: thou saidst <S%H559><s%>, Fear <S%H3372><s%> not.
O Lord <S%H136><s%>, thou hast pleaded <S%H7378><s%> the causes <S%H7379><s%> of my soul <S%H5315><s%>; thou hast redeemed <S%H1350><s%> my life <S%H2416><s%>.
O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, thou hast seen <S%H7200><s%> my wrong <S%H5792><s%>: judge <S%H8199><s%> thou my cause <S%H4941><s%>.
Thou hast seen <S%H7200><s%> all their vengeance <S%H5360><s%> and all their imaginations <S%H4284><s%> against me.
Thou hast heard <S%H8085><s%> their reproach <S%H2781><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, and all their imaginations <S%H4284><s%> against me;
The lips <S%H8193><s%> of those that rose up <S%H6965><s%> against me, and their device <S%H1902><s%> against me all the day <S%H3117><s%>.
Behold <S%H5027><s%> their sitting down <S%H3427><s%>, and their rising up <S%H7012><s%>; I am their musick <S%H4485><s%>.
Render <S%H7725><s%> unto them a recompence <S%H1576><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, according to the work <S%H4639><s%> of their hands <S%H3027><s%>.
Give <S%H5414><s%> them sorrow <S%H4044><s%> of heart <S%H3820><s%>, thy curse <S%H8381><s%> unto them. sorrow: or, obstinacy of heart
Persecute <S%H7291><s%> and destroy <S%H8045><s%> them in anger <S%H639><s%> from under the heavens <S%H8064><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>.
